That is stage lock I believe. You have your Caps Lock key on. You are locked at the stage you are on so that is why you cannot launch. Turn off Caps Lock.
Caps Lock is fine control. Alt+L or Ctrl+L is stage lock, I believe

Caps Lock is fine control. Alt+L or Ctrl+L is stage lock, I believe

I stand corrected.
Could you post screenshots of your vessel when this is happening? I'm not certain what pink light you refer to.

OdinYggd, to duplicate it launch a ship and press alt-L and press space.

Basically it sounds like you have stage lock enabled which prevents accidental staging. Now there is a bug where when you enable stage lock on one flight and you go launch a vehicle stage lock is still enabled preventing you from launching your rocket until you disable stage lock by pressing alt-L. On that same note, if you disable stage lock on one flight it will disable it for all flights, resulting in embarrassment if you accidentally hit spacebar on say your space station's escape pod deck. In all though it's quite the useful feature that has prevented accidental oops like dumping the return stage while still on the mun or firing off all the escape pods on my station, it just needs a bit more development like remembering whether or not it was enabled for which flights much like landing gear status does.

Alt-L (windows machine) fixes it. Many thanks. The pink light is located bottom left of your screen ( think its the same for our antipodean cousins too). Under the word 'Stage'. the light is normally green, or blinking green and the number on the odometer style indicator, refers to the next stage to be acrivated.

Also, make sure you aren't accidentally still time warping.
